intro: Cestichis schistochila, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Cestichis schistochila is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, waxy cuticle.
